instruction: How did the researchers combine the data from NIR and GC-MS technologies in the vine tea grade discrimination?
Output: The researchers combined the data from NIR (Near-Infrared) and GC-MS (Gas Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry) technologies in the vine tea grade discrimination through data fusion approaches. They used two machine learning methods, random forest (RF) and partial least squares-discrimination analysis (PLS-DA), to construct the tea grade discrimination platform with eight data-driven models. The researchers also implemented the Monte-Carlo technology to acquire more representative results from thirty sub-models. The mid-level fusion combined with RF yielded the most impressive performance, as it provided a more balanced matrix, efficient features, and remarkable discriminant ability for overall analysis.
